arts.ttl: 'We were second best': Reading boss issues honest verdict on Stockport County defeat
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt felt his side were 'second best' in Saturday's 3-1 defeat to Stockport County. Trailing by two goals inside 15 minutes through set pieces, Sam Smith pulled one back for the Royals on the hour-mark before Jack Diamond finished the scoring shortly after. Only a third home defeat of the season, it saw Dave Challinor's men leapfrog the Royals into the play-off places. Speaking after the game, Hunt said: "We made it tough for ourselves. We didn’t start the game right, and we didn’t earn the right to play. We gave ourselves a mountain to climb with two set play goals, which we’re disappointed about as a collective. It was a bit out of character for us because we’ve been good in the last six or seven weeks with set plays. "After that, we came in at half-time and started the second half better. We got a goal to get back into it and then the basics of the game: Be brave enough to play forward, we played it back. We don’t win a tackle, and we don’t recover or react, which costs us the game.

arts.ttl: Stockport County leapfrog Reading into play-off places with dominant away victory
arts.sum: Stockport County leapfrogged Reading into the play-off places with an effective 3-1 victory at the Select Car Leasing Stadium. Isaac Olaofe and Callum Connolly put Dave Challinor's men in a commanding lead at the break as the Royals were firmly second best. Sam Smith reduced the deficit on the hour mark but substitute Jack Diamond rounded off a convincing display for the Hatters, who won in Reading for the first time since 1992. Noel Hunt was able to introduce previously injured stars, such as Kelvin Ehibhatiomhan, Michael Craig and Jeriel Dorsett in the second half, one of the few positives in what was only the third defeat on home soil of the season. Despite kicking off with possession, it took Reading less than 90 seconds to be forced into their first defensive action of the half, a sign of things to come. Kyle Wootton fired wide of the near post and Olaofe came close all within the first three minutes.

arts.ttl: Stockport claim points at fellow play-off hopefuls Reading
arts.sum: Isaac Olaofe, Callum Connolly and  Jack Diamond struck for the visitors.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading host Stockport County in League One play-off battle
arts.sum: Sixth-place Reading host seventh-place Stockport County in a League One play-off race at the SCL Stadium. The Hatters have never played in RG2 until today, and last won in the town back in 1992. With both sides chasing down a position in the top six, it is all to play for this afternoon.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Noel Hunt boosted by key injury returns for Stockport County clash
arts.sum: Reading have been boosted with the return of key injured stars for this afternoon's clash with Stockport County. With an injury list as long as 10 names, and illness hitting the camp, Amadou Mbengue and Andy Yiadom remain out for some time. However, Kelvin Ehibhatiomhan, Michael Craig and Jeriel Dorsett are all deeed fit enough for a place on the bench against seventh-place Stockport. From the start, Joel Pereira remains between the sticks and behind a back four of Tivonge Rushesha, Harlee Dean, Tyler Bindon and Abraham Kanu.

arts.ttl: Reading boss previews Stockport County test and discusses 'fantastic' missing star
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt is wary of Stockport County and their squad, even after the exit of star striker Louie Barry. 21-year-old Aston Villa forward netted 16 goals in 24 appearances for the Hatters in the first half of the season, including 47 per cent of their goals away from home, but returned to Villa Park earlier this month. Sat seventh, directly behind the Royals, some may take Dave Challinor's side lightly without the key forward, but Hunt is still wary of the League Two champions, especially after October's 4-1 win at Edgeley Park. "He’s a fantastic player and has been great for them," Hunt said on Thursday. "He’s bumped up the league and took to the level really well, but they’ve got players that come in. They’re a strong squad and it will be a tough game for us."

arts.ttl: Preview: Reading vs. Stockport County - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's League One clash between Reading and Stockport County, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
